climbs.name: What Fools
climbs.fa: Ben Boykin, Greg Handelman, Robbie Giomi, Rob Kelman

content.description:
Start at a tree and follow 3 bolts up a slab to the hand-fist crack exit. The route required extensive cleaning. This climb is reminiscent of

FIUTT

on Mt. Lemmon Highway in Tucson. And like that climb, it will become harder if the tree were to die.
content.protection: 3 bolts, #1-#4 Camalots. Bolted rappel/belay station at the top.
content.location:
Ten yards right of

The Shortest Night

.

content.description: Climb the right-leaning and ever-narrowing splitter crack with the crux coming at the end.
content.protection:
#1-#5 Camalots and stoppers. There is a bolted belay/rappel station at the top, which is shared with

What Fools

.
content.location: Cross the bridge near the end of the Canyon and scramble towards the climb as seen in the Beta Photo of the area. If youre doing technical moves, youre not taking the easiest way.
